com.smartitengineering.exim
Interface Importer

public interface Importer

This API provides SPIs to use it to import objects from stream of media type it specifies. It is the responsibility of the API client to invoke it for appropriate MediaType. API implementors should explicitly mention the media type it supports. API implementors should also ensure thread safety.

Since:
0.4
Author:
imyousuf

Method Detail

isImportSupported

boolean isImportSupported(java.lang.Class clazz,
                          java.lang.reflect.Type genericType,
                          java.lang.annotation.Annotation[] annotations)
An operation that checks whether the the object type qualified by its class is supported by this importer. This operation should be consulted before invoking/using importObject.

Parameters:
clazz - The class quantifying the object type
genericType - The generic applied to the object, if any
annotations - Annotations used on the class
Returns:
True if and only if import is supported else false.

importObject

java.lang.Object importObject(java.lang.Class clazz,
                              java.lang.reflect.Type genericType,
                              java.lang.annotation.Annotation[] annotations,
                              java.io.InputStream inputStream,
                              java.util.Map<java.lang.Object,java.util.List<java.lang.Object>> headers)
                              throws java.io.IOException
Import the object quantified by clazz and genericType and qualified by the annotaitons from the inpuStream and use the headers to retrieve meta informations regarding the object.

Parameters:
clazz - The class of the object
genericType - The generic used with the object.
annotations - Annotations qualifying the object's class.
inputStream - The input stream to read and parse the object from.
headers - The headers that holds the meta information
Returns:
The object formed by from the input stream. Should never be NULL.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If any error in reading from the stream, i.e. either format error or any other error.

getMediaType

java.lang.String getMediaType()
Provides the MediaType that is supported by this importer.

Returns:
The supported media type
